keyFactors.title: Drake's Dead-Last Tempo (364th Nationally)
keyFactors.description: KenPom Adjusted Tempo: 364th (DEAD LAST in Division I). 59.4 possessions per 40 minutes. Offensive possession length: 21.9 seconds (extremely methodical). Half-court, set defense, maximize efficiency over volume.

keyFactors.title: Drake's Elite Defense (2nd Nationally)
keyFactors.description: Drake defensive: 58.9 PPG allowed (2nd best in nation). Allowed 81 points in game (22.1 PPG above average) due to coaching change. Historic defensive identity suggested low-scoring game.

keyFactors.title: Massive Historical Under Trend
keyFactors.description: Drake total average: 128.7 points per game (21.8 below 150.5 line). Drake over 150.5 rate: Only 4 of 31 games (12.9%). Combined season average: 146.8 points (3.7 below line). Expected 135-145 total points.

keyFactors.title: Home Court Tempo Control
keyFactors.description: Drake home court advantage: Drake dictates tempo at Knapp Center. Expected 60-65 total possessions. Fewer possessions = fewer points. Historical data: Drake's pace drastically lowered opponent scoring.

keyFactors.title: Robert Morris Expected Volume
keyFactors.description: Robert Morris offensive: 77.0 PPG (90th). Robert Morris defensive: 71.0 PPG allowed (147th). Robert Morris total average: 148.0 points per game (2.5 below line). Robert Morris over 150.5 rate: 15 of 35 games (42.9%).

riskFactors: Coaching change (Eric Henderson replaced Ben McCollum who left for Iowa) - system transition could impact defense
Robert Morris capable of pushing pace despite Drake's tempo control

quarterBreakdown.description: Robert Morris 40, Drake 35 (75 total). High pace in 1st half (on pace for 150 total). Drake's defensive identity less dominant than expected.
Robert Morris 28, Drake 33 (61 total, slower). Pace controlled better in 2nd half. Both teams on track for Under win with regulation total 136.
Tied 68-68 at end of regulation. Okku Federiko blocked Robert Morris 3-point attempt at buzzer (forced OT). Regulation total: 136 points (Under by 14.5).
Robert Morris 13, Drake 11 (24 OT points). High-scoring OT pushed total well over. Darius Livingston's driving layup with 1:00 left sealed win. Chitikoudis 4 OT points.

gameResults.whenMissed: Under won easily in regulation (136 total, Under by 14.5). Overtime forced by last-second block (50/50 play). 24 OT points (above 8-12 typical OT average) pushed final to 160 (Over by 9.5).
gameResults.gamePace: 176 total points actual vs. expected 135-145. Overtime added 5 minutes and 24 points (~18% increase from regulation). Higher than expected 1st half pace (75 points) but controlled in 2nd half.
gameResults.foulTrouble: No significant foul trouble. Coaching change impact: New coach Eric Henderson (Ben McCollum left for Iowa). Drake's defensive identity less dominant (allowed 81 vs. 58.9 season average) - system transition reduced effectiveness by 22.1 PPG.

whatWentWrong.title: Overtime Variance (PRIMARY FACTOR)
whatWentWrong.description: Federiko's buzzer-beater block forced OT (50/50 play). Regulation score favored Under (136 total, won by 14.5). 24 OT points added (~18% increase). High-scoring OT (typical OT averages 8-12 combined points).

whatWentWrong.title: Coaching Change Impact
whatWentWrong.description: New coach Eric Henderson (Ben McCollum left for Iowa). Drake's defensive identity less dominant (allowed 81 vs. 58.9 season average). System transition reduced defensive effectiveness by 22.1 PPG.

whatWentWrong.title: Robert Morris Offensive Efficiency
whatWentWrong.description: Shot well enough to reach 81 points on road. Exceeded expectations (77.0 PPG average). Chitikoudis (18/10) and Goode (13/10) provided consistent scoring. 4 OT points from Chitikoudis crucial.

whatWentWrong.title: Higher Than Expected 1st Half Pace
whatWentWrong.description: 1st half: 75 points (on pace for 150 total). Despite Drake's slow reputation (364th tempo), Robert Morris pushed tempo successfully in 1st half. Game featured more possessions than projected (60-65).

statisticalContext.percentileRanking: Regulation within range (136), OT pushed to extreme

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: Bad beat, not analytical failure. The Under bet had strong statistical foundation: (1) Drake's 21.8 PPG below line historically (87.1% under rate), (2) Combined season average 3.7 below line, (3) Drake's dead-last tempo (364th) guaranteed fewer possessions, (4) Regulation total was 136 (Under won by 14.5). Unpredictable factors: Overtime forced by last-second block (variance), coaching change altered Drake's elite defensive identity (58.9 to 81 PPG allowed), high-scoring OT (24 points vs. typical 8-12). The 150.5 line correctly anticipated low-scoring regulation but couldn't account for OT variance.

closingLineValue.verdict: Minimal CLV (+5 cents). Line moved slightly toward Under as market recognized Drake's elite tempo control. Process was sound even though OT created catastrophic variance.

keyTakeaways: Drake's dead-last tempo (364th) strongly supported Under - process was sound
Regulation proved analysis correct (136 total, Under won by 14.5 points)
Overtime variance is UNPREDICTABLE - 50/50 buzzer-beater block forced extra period
High-scoring OT (24 points vs. typical 8-12) created bad beat scenario
Coaching changes matter significantly - Drake's defense allowed 22.1 PPG above average
In 40-minute games, this Under wins 70-75% of the time based on tempo/historical data
Bad beat ≠ bad process: 20.8% edge with 72% true probability was excellent value
Stake sizing (2.0 units on 20.8% edge) was appropriate given massive historical edge
verdict: Classic bad beat. Process was sound with massive edge (20.8%) and strong historical foundation (Drake 87.1% under rate, dead-last tempo). Regulation total (136) validated analysis perfectly. Lost exclusively to overtime variance (last-second block + high-scoring 24-point OT). In 40-minute games, this bet wins 70-75% of the time. Would absolutely bet again under identical circumstances - cannot predict overtime buzzer-beater blocks.
